titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller University records, Hospital, Administrative Correspondence, Series 2
A Guide to the Rockefeller University records, Hospital, Administrative Correspondence, Series 2 FA837

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2015-10-26 07:56:37 -0400.

revisiondesc.item: Paper finding aid converted to EAD/XML by AureXus in 2010. Imported into the Archvistsâ€™ Toolkit by Becky Robbins.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller University records, Hospital, Administrative Correspondence, Series 2

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Rockefeller University records, Hospital is arranged in four series: Series 1: General Files. Series 2: Administrative Correspondence. Series 3: Subject Files. Series 4: Collected Reprints.
Series 3 is currently closed to scholarly research pending further processing.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: FA228 Rockefeller University records, Hospital, General Files, Series 1.
FA838 Rockefeller University records, Hospital, Subject Files, Series 3.
FA909 Rockefeller University records, Hospital, Collected Reprints, Series 4.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Materials requiring specialized equipment for access (film, audio, video, slides) may be restricted from scholarly research dependent on availability of the applicable equipment.
Brittle or damaged items, or materials otherwise in need of preservation care, may be restricted from scholarly research at the discretion of the RAC Head of Archival Services/RAC Head of Reference.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for scholarly research.

did.unittitle: Administrative correspondence
Rufus Cole

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Consists primarily of administrative correspondence between Rufus Cole, Director of RIMR Hospital and Simon Flexner and Business Managers. Includes many holographs.

Correspondence includes letters between Rufus Cole and Jerome D. Greene (1910-October 1912) dealing with details of hospital construction, applications for positions and other administrative details; with Henry James (1913-July 1918) includes material for presentation at meetings of Board of Scientific Directors and its Executive Committee; with Acting Business Manager and with F. Dickey (1918-1919) and Edric B. Smith after 1921. Items of special interest are:

did.unittitle: Letter to the Executive Committee from Dr. Cole asking approval to send Dr. Swift to Chicago to work for one week with Dr. Rosenau on the isolation of streptococcus
Copy of form letter sent to New York physicians regarding interest in pneumonia patients for acceptance in Hospital's treatment program
Letter from Alfred E. Cohn to Rufus Cole with data concerning the construction at Institute of Einthoven Galvanometer
Letter to Henry James from Rufus Cole expressing concern over conditions for preparation. of pneumonia serum

Copy of letter from Henry James to Rufus Cole covering October 20 the Resolution of Board of Scientific Directors to inform Surgeon General of ability and willingness to treat soldiers suffering from pneumonia at the Institute Hospital
Memorandum concerning Publication of a New Journal to be undertaken by The Institute as proposed by Rufus Cole and presented at meeting of Scientific Directors
Later, the Board approved in principle, a subsidy provided suitable arrangements could be made, [ed. note: Probably resulted in Journal of clinical investigation]
Copy of letter from Alfred E. Smith, Governor and Matthias Nicoll, Commissioner of Health, thanking Dr. Cole for medical care given to Thomas F. Foley
Correspondence on retirement of Dr. Cole and Minute adopted by Board of Trustees
Photographs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 33 photographs of Hospital staff. Some photos have identification.

did.unittitle: Booklets prepared in 1977 for the Convocation at which honorary degrees were presented to Michael Heidelberger and Irvine Heinly Page (former members of Hospital staff) from archives photos
Biographical materials
Copy from Who's Who; NAS Biographical Memoir, v. 50 pp 119-139
Reprint: The University Department of Medicine. Science n.s. 51 (1920) 329-340
Photographs (some with Hospital personnel)
Addresses made at retirement dinner

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Speakers: John D. Rockefeller, Jr., Charles R. Stockard, Herbert S. Gasser, Warfield T. Longcope, Thomas M. Rivers, Alfred E. Conn, Toastmaster.

did.unittitle: Bibliography
Correspondence
Human history, the 17th century and the Stuart family. Freeport, Maine, Bond Wheelwright Co.
Rough list of materials at American Philosophical Society where major portion of Rufus Cole papers are

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Listing was supplied by Phillip Miller, M.D. [Feb 2 1983. G. Lewis in examining the 1 folder on Rufus Cole material found only listings of:.

did.unittitle: Papers of dr. Rufus Cole: addresses and publications
Additional papers of dr. Rufus Cole: addresses and publications
Selected Papers by Dr. Cole

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes handwritten note possibly by Philip Miller "The American Philosophical Society has most of these papers, and * M.C. Childs ([Mary C. Childs, Dr. Cole's daughter Mary]) has a copy".

did.unittitle: 3 photogravures of Institute buildings, from the New York Architect

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Entrance, Hospital building, Entrance, Laboratory building, Laboratory building.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller Institute Dinner at the retirement of Rufus Cole. Radio and Film Methods Corp.
did.physdesc: Phonorecords. 33 1/3 speed, play from inside out. 1 package, 4 discs recorded on 7 sides.

did.unittitle: Alice Lockie

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Alice Lockie was superintendent of the Rockefeller Institute Hospital from 1939/40 until her retirement in June 1969.
These files were placed in the University archives by Miss Jo Armstrong on her retirement in June 1977.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Date received or inventoried: June 1977 (from Jo Armstrong).

did.unittitle: Archibald, R.M. Correspondence
Elliot, Roger. Correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Assorted administrative matters such as telephone usage; guards at entrances; emergency routines; snow removal schedules and some reports of accidents.

did.unittitle: Guest Book of party. "Memories of Rockefeller Review" snapshots and notes of songs by hospital patients for the hospital staff
Horsfall, Frank L. Correspondence
Deals with titles, appointments, meetings on occupational therapy schedule changes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes copy of 1971 obituary and draft of note sent with contributions from nursing and hospital staff.

did.unittitle: NAS Biographical memoir 2, 50 pp. 233-267
Miscellaneous items
Announcements of diseases under investigation
Report of Committee on Hospital Affairs
List of staff attending weekly clinical conferences 4 Conference announcements
Invitation to reunion dinner to honor Alice N. Lockie on her retirement
Dr. M. McCarty to P. Penndorf on conversion of Rooms B3 and B3A to storage
Occupational Therapy Report Patience News no. 1 (August 10, 1960) to no. 4 (April 1965)
Patient care facility

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Floor plan of Hospital 3rd floor and 3rd floor North wing showing stations for patient care.

did.unittitle: Rivers, Thomas M. Correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: On spending nights in the hospital; consents for surgery on patients under 18 years of age. Letter from T. Debevoise.

did.unittitle: Student Apartments lists and correspondence relating to furnishings of student apartments
Tuberculosis Unit

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence from Dr. Horsfall and James G. Hirsch on employee Tuberculin Testing Program. Includes lists of those tested and results as reported by Diethelm BÃ¶hme.
